Affliction.name: Affliction
Affliction.description: Impose some debilitating condition(s) on a target.

extras.name: Alternate Resistance
extras.description: Resisted by an alternate ability.

extras.name: Concentration
extras.description: So long as you continue to take a standard action each turn to maintain the effect, the target must make a new resistance check against it, with no attack check required.

extras.name: Cumulative
extras.description: Allows successive attacks to combine their effects.

extras.name: Extra Condition
extras.description: The affliction imposes an additional condition per degree of success.

extras.name: Progressive
extras.description: The affliction increase incrementally without any effort from you.

flaws.name: Instant Recovery
flaws.description: The target of an Affliction effect with this modifier recovers automatically, no check required, at the end of the round in which the duration ends.

flaws.name: Limited Degree
flaws.description: The target of an Affliction effect with this modifier recovers automatically, no check required, at the end of the round in which the duration ends.

modifierOptions.name: Limited to two degrees of effect
modifierOptions.description: The affliction is limited to no more than two degrees of effect.

modifierOptions.name: Limited to one degree of effect
modifierOptions.description: The affliction is limited to no more than a single degree of effect.

Burrowing.name: Burrowing
Burrowing.description: You can burrow through the ground, leaving a tunnel behind if you choose.

extras.name: Penetrating
extras.description: Allows burrowing to dig through super-hard materials that are impervious.

extras.name: Ranged
extras.description: Allows burrowing at a distance.

modifierOptions.name: Use at Range
modifierOptions.description: Allows the creation of tunnels at a greater distance (without having to be at the end-point of the tunnel as it forms).

modifierOptions.name: Grant burrowing to others
modifierOptions.description: Allows you to grant the Burrowing effect to someone else at a distance.

flaws.name: Limited
flaws.description: Limited to certain circumstances or materials such as only loose sand and soil or only snow and ice.

Communication.name: Communication
Communication.description: You can communicate over a distance using a medium other than your normal voice.

extras.name: Area
extras.description: You can broadcast omni-directionally to every receiver within your maximum communication range at once.

modifierOptions.name: Burst Area
modifierOptions.description: The effect fills a sphere with a 30-foot radius (distance rank 0) for rank 1 of the extra. Bursts on level surfaces (like the ground) create hemispheres 30 feet in radius and height.

modifierOptions.name: Cloud Area
modifierOptions.description: The effect fills a sphere with a 15-foot radius (distance rank –1) for rank 1 of the extra, that lingers in that area for one round after its duration expires (affecting any targets in the area normally during the additional round). Clouds on level surfaces (like the ground) create hemispheres 15 feet in radius and height.

modifierOptions.name: Cone Area
modifierOptions.description: The effect fills a cone with a length, width, and height of 60 feet (distance rank 1) for rank 1 of the extra, spreading out from the effect's starting point. Cones on a level surface halve their final height.

modifierOptions.name: Cylinder Area
modifierOptions.description: The effect fills a cylinder 30 feet in radius and height (distance rank 0) for rank 1 of the extra.

modifierOptions.name: Line Area
modifierOptions.description: The effect fills a path 6 feet wide and 30 feet long (distance ranks -2 and 0, respectively) in a straight line. Additional ranks of area increases the length. To increase the width, purchase additional ranks for that.

modifierOptions.name: Perception Area
modifierOptions.description: The effect works on anyone able to perceive the target point with a particular sense, chosen when you apply this extra, like a Sense-Dependent effect (see the Sense-Dependent modifier). Targets get a Dodge resistance check, as usual, but if the check is successful suffer no effect (rather than half). Concealment that prevents a target from perceiving the effect also blocks it. This modifier includes the Sense-Dependent flaw (see Flaws) so it cannot be applied again.

modifierOptions.name: Shapeable Area
modifierOptions.description: The effect fills a volume of 30 cubic feet (volume rank 5) for rank 1 of the extra, and you may shape the volume as you wish, so long as it all remains contiguous. Affecting an average-sized human requires 4 cubic feet (volume rank 2).

extras.name: Dimensional
extras.description: Communication with this modifier can bridge dimensional barriers, reaching into other dimensions and planes of existence.

extras.name: Rapid
extras.description: Your communication occurs 10 times faster than normal speech for each rank of this modifier.

extras.name: Selective
extras.description: If you have the Area extra, you can choose which receiver(s) within range get your communication, excluding everyone else.

extras.name: Subtle
extras.description: If you have the Area extra, you can choose which receiver(s) within range get your communication, excluding everyone else.

modifierOptions.name: Encrypted
modifierOptions.description: Your communication cannot be “overheard” (it is encrypted, scrambled, or otherwise protected).

modifierOptions.name: Undetectable
modifierOptions.description: Your communication cannot even be detected (that is, no one can even tell you are transmitting, much less what you're saying).

flaws.name: Limited
flaws.description: Limited to only members of a particular group, such as a species, family, members of an organization, and so forth.

flaws.name: Sense-Dependent
flaws.description: Other perception range effects can be Communication-Dependent, meaning you must be in communication with your subject for them to work.

Comprehend.name: Comprehend
Comprehend.description: You can comprehend different sorts of communication. Each rank gives one of Animals, Languages, Machines, Objects, Plants, Spirits.

flaws.name: Type
flaws.description: You can only comprehend a certain type of subject.

modifierOptions.name: Comprehend broad type
modifierOptions.description: You can only comprehend a broad type of subject (only elves, canines, avians, or sea creatures, for example).

modifierOptions.name: Comprehend narrow type
modifierOptions.description: You can only comprehend a narrow type of subject (dogs, falcons, or dolphins, for example).

Concealment.name: Concealment
Concealment.description: You gain total concealment from a particular sense while this effect is active.

extras.name: Affects Others
extras.description: This modifier allows you to grant Concealment to others while you are touching them, or at range, if you also apply the Range modifier.

extras.name: Area
extras.description: Concealment with Affects Others or attack may have this extra, affecting everything in the area.

modifierOptions.name: Burst Area
modifierOptions.description: The effect fills a sphere with a 30-foot radius (distance rank 0) for rank 1 of the extra. Bursts on level surfaces (like the ground) create hemispheres 30 feet in radius and height.

modifierOptions.name: Cloud Area
modifierOptions.description: The effect fills a sphere with a 15-foot radius (distance rank –1) for rank 1 of the extra, that lingers in that area for one round after its duration expires (affecting any targets in the area normally during the additional round). Clouds on level surfaces (like the ground) create hemispheres 15 feet in radius and height.

modifierOptions.name: Cone Area
modifierOptions.description: The effect fills a cone with a length, width, and height of 60 feet (distance rank 1) for rank 1 of the extra, spreading out from the effect's starting point. Cones on a level surface halve their final height.

modifierOptions.name: Cylinder Area
modifierOptions.description: The effect fills a cylinder 30 feet in radius and height (distance rank 0) for rank 1 of the extra.

modifierOptions.name: Line Area
modifierOptions.description: The effect fills a path 6 feet wide and 30 feet long (distance ranks -2 and 0, respectively) in a straight line. Additional ranks of area increases the length. To increase the width, purchase additional ranks for that.

modifierOptions.name: Perception Area
modifierOptions.description: The effect works on anyone able to perceive the target point with a particular sense, chosen when you apply this extra, like a Sense-Dependent effect (see the Sense-Dependent modifier). Targets get a Dodge resistance check, as usual, but if the check is successful suffer no effect (rather than half). Concealment that prevents a target from perceiving the effect also blocks it. This modifier includes the Sense-Dependent flaw (see Flaws) so it cannot be applied again.

modifierOptions.name: Shapeable Area
modifierOptions.description: The effect fills a volume of 30 cubic feet (volume rank 5) for rank 1 of the extra, and you may shape the volume as you wish, so long as it all remains contiguous. Affecting an average-sized human requires 4 cubic feet (volume rank 2).

extras.name: Attack
extras.description: Use this extra for a Concealment effect you can impose on others (whether they want to be concealed or not).

extras.name: Precise
extras.description: You can vary your Concealment at will as a free action: going from total to partial to no concealment, concealing some parts and not others, or anywhere in-between. If your Concealment affects multiple senses, you can also choose to affect some of those senses and not others.

flaws.name: Blending
flaws.description: You "blend" into the background. Your Concealment only functions as long as you move no faster than your (ground speed rank –1), since your blending can't adapt faster than that.

flaws.name: Limited
flaws.description: Your Concealment only works under certain conditions, such as in fog, shadows, or in urban locales. One example is Limited to Machines, where your Concealment only fools senses with a technological descriptor.

flaws.name: Partial
flaws.description: Your effect provides partial rather than total concealment.

flaws.name: Passive
flaws.description: Your Concealment only lasts until you do something requiring an attack or effect check on your part, at which point it stops working until you reactivate it, which you may do on the following round.

flaws.name: Resistible
flaws.description: Your Concealment offers a resistance check (chose a defense when the flaw is applied) for anyone aware of your presence and actively looking for you.

Create.name: Create
Create.description: You can form solid objects essentially out of nowhere.

extras.name: Continuous
extras.description: Makes objects that remain until they are destroyed, nullified, or you choose to dismiss them.

extras.name: Impervious
extras.description: This makes the objects' Toughness Impervious.

extras.name: Innate
extras.description: Continuous or Permanent Create with this modifier makes objects that cannot be nullified, they're essentially “real” objects for all intents and purposes (although the user can "unmake" them at will unless the effect is also permanent).

extras.name: Movable
extras.description: You can move your created objects around with a Move Object effect at your Create rank.

extras.name: Precise
extras.description: You can create more precise and detailed objects with moving parts, and considerable detail.

extras.name: Selective
extras.description: You can make your created objects selectively "transparent" to attacks, blocking some while allowing others (yours and your allies', for example) to pass through them. You can also selectively make your objects solid to some creatures and incorporeal to others, such as allowing one person to walk through a created wall, while blocking another.

extras.name: Stationary
extras.description: Your created objects can hang immobile in the air. They resist being moved with a Strength rank equal to the modifier rank.

extras.name: Subtle
extras.description: Your created objects can hang immobile in the air. They resist being moved with a Strength rank equal to the modifier rank.

modifierOptions.name: Appears Real
modifierOptions.description: Created objects are not noticeable as constructs (they look just like real objects).

modifierOptions.name: Invisible
modifierOptions.description: Created objects are not noticeable at all (such as objects composed of invisible force).

extras.name: Tether
extras.description: You have a connection to your created objects, allowing you to exert your own Strength to move them (provided you are strong enough to do so).

flaws.name: Feedback
flaws.description: You may suffer damage when your created objects are damaged.

flaws.name: Permanent
flaws.description: Permanent created objects last until destroyed or nullified.

flaws.name: Proportional
flaws.description: Your created objects have a total volume rank plus Toughness rank equal to your Create rank.

Damage.name: Damage
Damage.description: You can inflict damage by making a close attack.

extras.name: Strength Based
extras.description: A Damage effect can be Strength-based -- something like a melee weapon -- allowing your Strength Damage to add to it. You add your Strength and Damage ranks together when determining the rank of the attack.

Deflect.name: Deflect
Deflect.description: You can actively defend for characters other than yourself, deflecting or diverting attacks.

extras.name: Reflect
extras.description: You can reflect attacks as a free action.

modifierOptions.name: Reflect
modifierOptions.description: You can reflect attacks back at the attacker as a free action.

modifierOptions.name: Redirect
modifierOptions.description: You can redirect attacks you successfully deflect at any target within the attack's normal range.

Elongation.name: Elongation
Elongation.description: You can elongate your body and/or limbs to extend your reach.

Enhanced Trait.name: Enhanced Trait
Enhanced Trait.description: You can temporarily improve one of your existing traits.

Enhanced Slight of Hand.name: Enhanced Slight of Hand
Enhanced Slight of Hand.description: You enhance your Slight of Hand skill.

flaws.name: Limited
flaws.description: Enhanced Traits are often Limited in some fashion, such as Nighttime (or Daytime) Only, While Angry (or in another emotional state), Underwater (or in some other environment), and so forth.

flaws.name: Permanent
flaws.description: At no change in cost, your Enhanced Trait may be a permanent improvement, rather than a sustained effect.

flaws.name: Reduced Trait
flaws.description: One or more of your traits is lowered while others are enhanced. This flaw is worth as many points as the reduction in the affected trait(s).

Environment.name: Environment
Environment.description: You can change the environment in an area.

Create Intense Cold.name: Create Intense Cold
Create Intense Cold.description: You can lower the temperature in the area to intense cold.

Create Extreme Cold.name: Create Extreme Cold
Create Extreme Cold.description: You can lower the temperature in the area to extreme levels.

Create Intense Heat.name: Create Intense Heat
Create Intense Heat.description: You can raise the temperature in the area to intense heat.

Create Extreme Heat.name: Create Extreme Heat
Create Extreme Heat.description: You can raise the temperature in the area to extreme levels.

Impede Movement.name: Impede Movement
Impede Movement.description: You can impede movement through the area with high winds, icy or wet surfaces, or similar effects, reducing movement speed by 1 rank.

Severely Impede Movement.name: Severely Impede Movement
Severely Impede Movement.description: You can severely impede movement through the area with high winds, icy or wet surfaces, or similar effects, reducing movement speed by 2 ranks.

Generate Light.name: Generate Light
Generate Light.description: You can create enough light to reduce total concealment to partial and partial concealment to none.

Generate Daylight.name: Generate Daylight
Generate Daylight.description: You can shed light as bright as a sunlit day, eliminating all concealment provided by natural darkness.

Reduce Visibility.name: Reduce Visibility
Reduce Visibility.description: You impose a -2 modifier to Perception checks.

Severely Reduce Visibility.name: Severely Reduce Visibility
Severely Reduce Visibility.description: You impose a -5 modifier to Perception checks.

extras.name: Selective
extras.description: With this extra you can vary the environment within your affected area, affecting some while not affecting others, or even mixing and matching different environments (making part of the area cold and another hot, for example).

Extra Limbs.name: Extra Limbs
Extra Limbs.description: You have extra manipulative limbs, such as arms, tentacles, or even prehensile hair or a tail.

extras.name: Continuous
extras.description: Continuous Extra Limbs are a power effect you can turn on and off at will, but that remain until you choose to deactivate them, even if you are stunned or incapacitated.

extras.name: Projection
extras.description: Your Extra Limbs are merely a projection of your power rather than an extension of your body. therefore, any harm directed specifically against your Extra Limb(s) has no effect.

extras.name: Sustained
extras.description: Sustained Extra Limbs can be turned on or off (growing or forming the additional limbs and then making them disappear just as easily), but the limbs disappear or stop working if you are unable to continue the effect.

flaws.name: Distracting
flaws.description: Coordinating the actions of your multiple limbs is difficult, so you are vulnerable while applying any extra limbs to an action.

Feature.name: Feature
Feature.description: You have one or more minor features, effects granting you an occasional useful ability.

Flight.name: Flight
Flight.description: You can fly through the air, including hovering.

extras.name: Aquatic
extras.description: You can move underwater as easily as in the air. You have a water speed equal to your Flight rank, minus 2, subject to the usual rules for swimming (see Athletics for details). You can make Athletics checks to swim as routine checks.

extras.name: Continuous
extras.description: Continuous Flight operates even when the user is incapacitated or otherwise unable to sustain it. The user remains hanging in the air, maintaining relative position to the ground, if necessary. Alternately, the user might float safely down to the ground when unable to maintain Flight as a kind of “safety net,” your choice when you apply the modifier.

extras.name: Subtle
extras.description: The default Flight effect is noticeable, whether from the rush of air, the roar of jets, or a glowing contrail or aurora, for example. This modifier reduces, and then eliminates, these traces.

modifierOptions.name: Mostly Subtle
modifierOptions.description: Your flight lacks a glowing contrail, rushing jets, or other obvious features.

modifierOptions.name: Completely Subtle
modifierOptions.description: Your flight is completely unremarkable and you do not need to make Stealth checks to move silently while flying.

flaws.name: Concentration
flaws.description: Flight requiring concentration means you can fly, but can't do much else at the same time.

flaws.name: Distracting
flaws.description: You are not very maneuverable and therefore vulnerable while flying.

flaws.name: Gliding
flaws.description: You fly by gliding on wind currents. Your maximum gliding distance is limited to the vertical distance rank of your starting height, plus your flight speed rank.

flaws.name: Levitation
flaws.description: You can only move vertically, straight up and down, and not side to side, although you can allow yourself to be carried along in the direction of the wind horizontally.

flaws.name: Platform
flaws.description: Your Flight is reliant on some sort of platform on which you stand or sit. If you fail a resistance check while flying, or you are grabbed by someone standing on the ground, you're knocked or pulled off your platform and cannot fly.

flaws.name: Wings
flaws.description: You have wings that allow you to fly, but they run the risk of being fouled or restrained, which prevents you from flying. If you are immobilized, restrained, or bound, you cannot fly.

Growth.name: Growth
Growth.description: You can temporarily increase your size.

extras.name: Permanent
extras.description: Permanent Growth, typically with innate, suits giant-sized characters and creatures that are a fixed larger size.

Healing.name: Healing
Healing.description: You can heal Damage conditions by touching a subject and taking a standard action.

extras.name: Action
extras.description: This extra reduces the action required for you to use Healing. You cannot use Healing more than once per turn regardless.

extras.name: Affects Objects
extras.description: Your Healing can also "heal" damage to non-living subjects.

extras.name: Area
extras.description: Healing with this extra grants the same benefit to all subjects in the affected area.

modifierOptions.name: Burst Area
modifierOptions.description: The effect fills a sphere with a 30-foot radius (distance rank 0) for rank 1 of the extra. Bursts on level surfaces (like the ground) create hemispheres 30 feet in radius and height.

modifierOptions.name: Cloud Area
modifierOptions.description: The effect fills a sphere with a 15-foot radius (distance rank –1) for rank 1 of the extra, that lingers in that area for one round after its duration expires (affecting any targets in the area normally during the additional round). Clouds on level surfaces (like the ground) create hemispheres 15 feet in radius and height.

modifierOptions.name: Cone Area
modifierOptions.description: The effect fills a cone with a length, width, and height of 60 feet (distance rank 1) for rank 1 of the extra, spreading out from the effect's starting point. Cones on a level surface halve their final height.

modifierOptions.name: Cylinder Area
modifierOptions.description: The effect fills a cylinder 30 feet in radius and height (distance rank 0) for rank 1 of the extra.

modifierOptions.name: Line Area
modifierOptions.description: The effect fills a path 6 feet wide and 30 feet long (distance ranks -2 and 0, respectively) in a straight line. Additional ranks of area increases the length. To increase the width, purchase additional ranks for that.

modifierOptions.name: Perception Area
modifierOptions.description: The effect works on anyone able to perceive the target point with a particular sense, chosen when you apply this extra, like a Sense-Dependent effect (see the Sense-Dependent modifier). Targets get a Dodge resistance check, as usual, but if the check is successful suffer no effect (rather than half). Concealment that prevents a target from perceiving the effect also blocks it. This modifier includes the Sense-Dependent flaw (see Flaws) so it cannot be applied again.

modifierOptions.name: Shapeable Area
modifierOptions.description: The effect fills a volume of 30 cubic feet (volume rank 5) for rank 1 of the extra, and you may shape the volume as you wish, so long as it all remains contiguous. Affecting an average-sized human requires 4 cubic feet (volume rank 2).

extras.name: Energizing
extras.description: You can heal the fatigued and exhausted conditions as well as damage conditions: DC 10, one degree of success for fatigued, two degrees of success for exhausted. However, you take on the removed conditions and cannot use Healing to eliminate your own fatigue.

extras.name: Perception
extras.description: Applied to Ranged Healing, perception Ranged Healing does not require an attack check to “touch” the subject.

extras.name: Persistent
extras.description: Your Healing can remove even Incurable effects.

extras.name: Ranged
extras.description: Ranged Healing requires an attack check to "touch" the subject with the Healing effect. The GM may waive the check for a willing subject holding completely still, but the subject is defenseless that round, making it an unwise decision in the midst of combat.

extras.name: Restorative
extras.description: Your Healing effect can restore character points removed by Weaken effects with the appropriate descriptors, such as injury, disease, or poison.

extras.name: Resurrection
extras.description: If the subject has been dead for fewer minutes than your Healing rank, makes a DC 20 Healing check. If successful, the patient's condition becomes incapacitated, as if just stabilized. If the check fails, you can only try again using extra effort.

extras.name: Selective
extras.description: Area Healing may have this extra, allowing you to choose who in the area does and does not gain the benefits.

extras.name: Stabilize
extras.description: You don't need to make a Healing check to stabilize a dying character, your Healing effect does so automatically, although it still requires the normal standard action.

flaws.name: Empathic
flaws.description: When you successfully cure someone else of a condition, you acquire the condition yourself and must recover from it normally.

flaws.name: Limited
flaws.description: Examples of ways in which Healing may be Limited include: One Type of Damage (such as energy or bludgeoning damage), Objects (in conjunction with Affects Objects), Others (you can't use Healing on yourself), or Self (you can only use Healing on yourself).

flaws.name: Temporary
flaws.description: The benefits of your Healing are temporary, lasting for one hour. The subject then regains any damage conditions you healed.

Illusion.name: Illusion
Illusion.description: You can control others' senses to create false impressions or illusions.

One Sense Types.name: One Sense Types
One Sense Types.description: You can create an illusion affecting a single sense type.

Two Sense Types.name: Two Sense Types
Two Sense Types.description: You can create an illusion affecting two sense types. (Visual senses counts as two types.)

Three Sense Types.name: Three Sense Types
Three Sense Types.description: You can create an illusion affecting three sense types. (Visual senses counts as two types.)

Four Sense Types.name: Four Sense Types
Four Sense Types.description: You can create an illusion affecting four sense types. (Visual senses counts as two types.)

Five Sense Types.name: Five Sense Types
Five Sense Types.description: You can create an illusion affecting all sense types.

extras.name: Independent
extras.description: Your active illusions only require a free action to maintain, rather than a standard action.

extras.name: Selective
extras.description: You choose who perceives your Illusion and who doesn't.

flaws.name: Feedback
flaws.description: A successful damaging attack on one of your illusions causes you to suffer damage.

flaws.name: Limited to One Subject
flaws.description: Only a single subject at a time can perceive your Illusion.

flaws.name: Ranged
flaws.description: It is left to the GM's discretion whether or not Illusion's range can be reduced at all, since being able to perceive the affected area is important in creating and directing the illusion.

flaws.name: Resistible
flaws.description: Illusions Resistible by Will are typically hallucinatory effects projected into the target's mind. Illusions Resistible by Fortitude may represent a hallucinatory drug or similar biochemical effect. This resistance check is in addition to the usual Insight check; the first determines if the target can resist the effect creating the illusion, the Insight check determine if the target notices something wrong about the illusion, revealing it as false.

flaws.name: Limited
flaws.description: Specify a reasonably common effect (or set of uncommon effects) that keeps you from recovering from death, such as beheading, cremation, a stake through the heart, and so forth.

Immunity.name: Immunity
Immunity.description: You are immune to certain effects.

extras.name: Affects Others
extras.description: This extra allows you to grant the benefits of your Immunity to others by touch.

extras.name: Sustained
extras.description: Sustained duration Immunity may be suitable for certain types of powers, particularly force fields or similar protective abilities requiring a modicum of concentration.

extras.name: Ranged
extras.description: Affects Others Immunity may have this extra, allowing it to grant its benefits at range.

extras.name: Reflect
extras.description: You can reflect attacks to which you are immune back at the attacker as a free action. Make a normal attack check using your own attack modifier to hit with the reflected attack. It has its normal effect if it hits.

extras.name: Redirect
extras.description: You can redirect attacks to which are you are immune at any other target within the attack's normal range, as Reflect, above. You must have the Reflect extra to take this one.

flaws.name: Limited to Half Effect
flaws.description: You suffer half the normal effect rather than being entirely immune to it. For environmental effects, you only make checks half as often. For other effects, halve the effect's rank (round down) before determining its resistance check DC, including for things like Impervious.

Insubstantial.name: Insubstantial
Insubstantial.description: You can assume a less solid form, with each rank becoming progressively less solid.

extras.name: Affects Others
extras.description: This modifier allows you to extend your Insubstantial effect to another character by touch, taking them Insubstantial with you.

modifierOptions.name: Affects Only Others
modifierOptions.description: The effect affects only others, and not you.

modifierOptions.name: Self and Others
modifierOptions.description: It can affect yourself and others.

extras.name: Attack
extras.description: Applied to Insubstantial, this extra makes it into a close range effect able to turn targets Insubstantial.

modifierOptions.name: Insubstantial Attack Only
modifierOptions.description: The effect affects only others, and not you.

modifierOptions.name: Self and Attack
modifierOptions.description: you can both be Insubstantial and make an attack to make others Insubstantial.

extras.name: Continuous
extras.description: Extending the effect's duration to continuous allows you to remain Insubstantial until you choose to return to your corporeal form.

extras.name: Innate
extras.description: Use this modifier if your character’s form is naturally or innately Insubstantial, particularly if the effect is permanent in duration.

extras.name: Precise
extras.description: This modifier allows you to selectively make some portions of your body insubstantial while keeping others substantial (or vice versa).

extras.name: Progressive
extras.description: You can assume lower ranked forms of Insubstantial, but you must progress through them in order to reach the higher-ranked ones.

extras.name: Reaction
extras.description: At the GM's option, applying the Action extra to use Insubstantial as a reaction allows you to switch forms "reflexively" in response to such hazards, even if it is not your turn.

extras.name: Subtle
extras.description: This extra makes your Insubstantial nature less noticeable to observers.

modifierOptions.name: Requires Perception Check
modifierOptions.description: It requires a Perception check (DC 20) to detect that you are Insubstantial.

modifierOptions.name: Looks Normal
modifierOptions.description: You look entirely normal in Insubstantial form (which may cause opponents to waste effort on you, not knowing you are immune to their attacks, for example).

flaws.name: Absent Strength
flaws.description: This flaw applies only to rank 1 Insubstantial and removes your effective Strength while in that form, leaving you with limited ability to affect the physical world like the higher ranks of the effect.

flaws.name: Permanent
flaws.description: You are always Insubstantial; you cannot assume solid form, although your Insubstantial effect can still be Nullified unless it is also Innate.

Leaping.name: Leaping
Leaping.description: You can make prodigious leaps, far more than even a skilled athlete.

extras.name: Affects Others
extras.description: You can give someone you are touching the ability to leap.

modifierOptions.name: Affects Only Others
modifierOptions.description: You can give someone you are touching the ability to leap, but not yourself.

modifierOptions.name: Affects Others
modifierOptions.description: Both you and the person you touch can leap.

flaws.name: Acrobatics Check Required
flaws.description: In order to use Leaping, you must make an Acrobatics skill check (DC 10). Each point your check total exceeds the DC allows you to use 1 rank of Leaping, up to your total rank.

flaws.name: Full Power
flaws.description: With this flaw, you can only leap your maximum distance; you can make shorter leaps only by not using your Leaping effect at all, just the normal jumping distance for your Strength.

Luck Control.name: Luck Control
Luck Control.description: You influence luck in various ways.

extras.name: Area
extras.description: Your Luck Control effect works equally on all targets in the affected area. You spend only one victory point, but the subjects are each affected individually.

modifierOptions.name: Burst Area
modifierOptions.description: Your Luck Control effect fills a sphere with a 30-foot radius (distance rank 0) for rank 1 of the extra. Bursts on level surfaces (like the ground) create hemispheres 30 feet in radius and height.

modifierOptions.name: Cloud Area
modifierOptions.description: Your Luck Control effect fills a sphere with a 15-foot radius (distance rank –1) for rank 1 of the extra, that lingers in that area for one round after its duration expires (affecting any targets in the area normally during the additional round). Clouds on level surfaces (like the ground) create hemispheres 15 feet in radius and height.

modifierOptions.name: Cone Area
modifierOptions.description: Your Luck Control effect fills a cone with a length, width, and height of 60 feet (distance rank 1) for rank 1 of the extra, spreading out from the effect’s starting point. Cones on a level surface halve their final height.

modifierOptions.name: Cylinder Area
modifierOptions.description: Your Luck Control effect fills a cylinder 30 feet in radius and height (distance rank 0) for rank 1 of the extra.

modifierOptions.name: Line Area
modifierOptions.description: Your Luck Control effect fills a path 6 feet wide and 30 feet long (distance ranks -2 and 0, respectively) in a straight line. Additional ranks of area increases the length. To increase the width, purchase additional ranks for that.

modifierOptions.name: Perception Area
modifierOptions.description: Your Luck Control effect works on anyone able to perceive the target point with a particular sense, chosen when you apply this extra, like a Sense-Dependent effect (see the Sense-Dependent modifier). Targets get a Dodge resistance check, as usual, but if the check is successful suffer no effect (rather than half). Concealment that prevents a target from perceiving the effect also blocks it. This modifier includes the Sense-Dependent flaw (see Flaws) so it cannot be applied again.

modifierOptions.name: Shapeable Area
modifierOptions.description: Your Luck Control effect fills a volume of 30 cubic feet (volume rank 5) for rank 1 of the extra, and you may shape the volume as you wish, so long as it all remains contiguous. Affecting an average-sized human requires 4 cubic feet (volume rank 2).

extras.name: Luck
extras.description: Each rank in this extra gives you the benefit of a rank in the Luck advantage.

extras.name: Selective
extras.description: This extra, applied to Area Luck Control, allows you to choose who in the area is or is not affected by it.

flaws.name: Increased Action
flaws.description: Increases action required to use effect from reaction->free->move->standard for each rank. If the action required for Luck Control is increased beyond a reaction, it is only usable during your turn each round, which limits its usefulness in responding to the actions of others.

flaws.name: Ranged
flaws.description: Luck Control normally requires no attack check; if Ranged, it does.

flaws.name: Resistible
flaws.description: Targets of your Luck Control get a resistance check -- usually Dodge or Will—to avoid its effects.

flaws.name: Side Effect
flaws.description: As a particular side effect of Luck Control, you may suffer a setback without earning a victory point.

modifierOptions.name: Side effect on failure
modifierOptions.description: If your effort to alter luck fails, you suffer a setback without earning a victory point.

modifierOptions.name: Side effect on use
modifierOptions.description: You suffer a setback without earning a victory point every time you attempt to use Luck Control.

Mind Reading.name: Mind Reading
Mind Reading.description: You can read another character's mind.

extras.name: Cumulative
extras.description: Your Mind Reading adds any further degrees of success to the existing degree on the target, rather than using just the result of the new opposed check.

extras.name: Effortless
extras.description: Trying again after two or more degrees of failure does not require extra effort for you.

extras.name: Sensory Link
extras.description: You can "tap into" the senses of your subjects, perceiving what they perceive like a Remote Sensing effect so long as you have at least one degree of contact.

extras.name: Subtle
extras.description: Mind Reading is only noticeable to the subject or to characters with an appropriate mental sense. Subtle Mind Reading is less detectable.

modifierOptions.name: Subtle
modifierOptions.description: Requires a DC 20 Perception check for the subject or characters with an appropriate mental sense to detect it.

modifierOptions.name: Undetectable
modifierOptions.description: Cannot be detected.

flaws.name: Close
flaws.description: Applied to Ranged Mind Reading, Close Mind Reading requires a close attack check to touch an unwilling target and physical contact throughout the effect's duration.

flaws.name: Feedback
flaws.description: You suffer Feedback if a subject you are reading is harmed, using your Mind Reading rank as the resistance check bonus against the damage. Additionally, you may suffer Feedback from reading or experiencing particularly traumatic or emotionally-charged thoughts or memories from the subject.

flaws.name: Limited by Language
flaws.description: You can only understand the subject's thoughts or memories if you share a common language.

flaws.name: Limited to Emotions
flaws.description: You can only read or probe for emotions and emotional associations, not coherent thoughts or memories.

flaws.name: Limited to Sensory Link
flaws.description: If you have the Sensory Link extra and this flaw, you can only tap into a subject's senses, you cannot read their thoughts or memories.

flaws.name: Limited to Surface Thoughts
flaws.description: You can only read surface thoughts and cannot achieve higher degrees of contact.

flaws.name: Ranged
flaws.description: Ranged Mind Reading requires a ranged attack check in addition to the effect's normal resistance check.

flaws.name: Sense-Dependent
flaws.description: Your Mind Reading is dependent on a sense other than just having to accurately sense the target, such as needing to see his expressions (Sight-Dependent), hear him speak (Hearing-Dependent), smell his changes in biochemistry (Scent-Dependent), and so forth. Alternately, it may be dependent on first being in Mental Communication with the target.

extras.name: Attack
extras.description: A Morph Attack imposes a different appearance on the target creature.

extras.name: Metamorph
extras.description: This modifier allows you to have an alternate set of traits, essentially a complete alternate character you change into, one set of traits per rank in Metamorph.

flaws.name: Resistible
flaws.description: Observers who succeed on the Will resistance check see you as you truly are rather than in your Morph guise. This is in addition to the usual Perception check to penetrate your disguise.

Move Object.name: Move Object
Move Object.description: You can move objects at a distance without touching them.

extras.name: Continuous
extras.description: The GM may allow Continuous Move Object as a variation that is not disrupted when you are unable to maintain it, but that still requires your conscious attention to do anything other than have the affected object hang in midair. You must make Move Object's duration Sustained before you can make it Continuous.

extras.name: Damaging
extras.description: Your effect can inflict damage, like an application of normal Strength with damage equal to its rank.

extras.name: Improvised Weapon Mastery
extras.description: Each rank of Improvised Weapon Mastery increases by 1 the damage of objects wielded using Move Object.

extras.name: Throwing Mastery
extras.description: Each rank of Throwing Mastery increases by 1 the damage of objects thrown using Move Object.

extras.name: Perception
extras.description: Perception Ranged Move Object can affect any object you can accurately perceive, with no need for an attack check.

extras.name: Precise
extras.description: Move Object with this modifier can be used for tasks involving fine manipulation.

extras.name: Subtle
extras.description: Apply the Subtle modifier for a less noticeable Move Object effect, such as invisible "psychokinesis".

flaws.name: Close
flaws.description: At the GM's discretion, a Close Ranged Move Object effect may represent "tactile telekinesis" or a supernatural influence over objects you are able to touch, but such things are usually better represented by the Enhanced Strength effect.

flaws.name: Concentration
flaws.description: Concentration Move Object requires more attention to maintain. You cannot concentrate to increase your lifting capacity or to grab or move another object while you are still "holding" your first.

flaws.name: Limited Direction
flaws.description: You can only move objects in a particular direction or path, such as only up and down (towards and away from the ground), only directly towards or away from you (attraction and repulsion), and so forth.

flaws.name: Limited Material
flaws.description: You can only move a particular type of object or material.

modifierOptions.name: Limited Material
modifierOptions.description: You can only move a particular type of object or material, such as only metals, plants, rock, water, and so forth.

modifierOptions.name: Very Limited Material
modifierOptions.description: The GM may allow a flaw where you can only move a very limited type of material, such as only precious metals, leaves, sand, or petroleum.

Movement.name: Movement
Movement.description: You have a special form of movement.

Dimension Travel.name: Dimension Travel
Dimension Travel.description: You can move instantly from one dimension to another as a move action. For 1 rank, you can move between your home dimension and one other. For 2 ranks you can move between any of a related group of dimensions (mystical dimensions, alien dimensions, etc). For 3 ranks you can travel to any dimension.

Environmental Adaptation.name: Environmental Adaptation
Environmental Adaptation.description: You’re adapted to a particular environment, such as underwater, zero gravity, and so forth. You suffer none of the normal unfavorable circumstance or movement penalties associated with that environment, moving and acting normally.

Permeate.name: Permeate
Permeate.description: For 1 rank, you can move at speed rank –2 through any physical object. For 2 ranks, you can move at speed rank –1 and for 3 ranks, you move at your normal speed through any obstacles.

Safe Fall.name: Safe Fall
Safe Fall.description: So long as you are capable of action, you can fall any distance without harm. You can also stop your fall at any point along a distance so long as there is a handhold or projection for you to grab.

Slithering.name: Slithering
Slithering.description: You can move while prone at your normal ground speed. You suffer no circumstance penalty for making attacks while prone.

Space Travel.name: Space Travel
Space Travel.description: You can travel faster than the speed of light through the vacuum of space (but not in a planetary atmosphere). At rank 1 you can travel to other planets in a solar system. At rank 2, you can travel to other star systems, while at rank 3, you can visit distant star systems, perhaps even other galaxies.

Sure-Footed.name: Sure-Footed
Sure-Footed.description: You’re better able to deal with obstacles and obstructions to movement. Reduce the speed penalty for moving through or around such obstacles by 1 for each rank of this effect.

Swinging.name: Swinging
Swinging.description: You can swing through the air at your normal ground speed rank, using a swing-line you provide or available lines and projections (tree limbs, flagpoles, vines, telephone and power lines, etc.).

Time Travel.name: Time Travel
Time Travel.description: You can move through time! For 1 rank, you can move between the present and another fixed point in time (such as 100 years into the past, or 1,000 years into the future). For 2 ranks you can move to any point in the past or any point in the future (but not both). For 3 ranks, you can travel to any point in time.

Trackless.name: Trackless
Trackless.description: You leave no trail and cannot be tracked by one sense type such as visual senses. You can walk across the surface of soft sand or snow without leaving tracks and you have total concealment from tremorsense. Each additional rank renders you trackless to another sense type.

Wall-Crawling.name: Wall-Crawling
Wall-Crawling.description: You can climb walls and ceilings at your ground speed rank –1 with no chance of falling and no need for an Athletics check. You are still vulnerable while climbing, however. An additional rank of this effect means you climb at your full speed rank and are not vulnerable while climbing.

Water-Walking.name: Water-Walking
Water-Walking.description: You can stand or move at your normal ground speed on the surface of water, quicksand, and other liquids without sinking. If you fall prone for any reason, you sink into the liquid normally. With 2 ranks of this effect, you can also lie prone on a liquid surface without sinking; you only sink if you choose to.

Nullify.name: Nullify
Nullify.description: Nullify can counter effects of a particular descriptor, such as fire or magic.

extras.name: Alternate Resistance
extras.description: Nullify may require a Fortitude rather than a Will check to represent an effect resisted by health and stamina rather than strength of will.

extras.name: Area
extras.description: Make a single power check and compare the result against the opposed checks of each target in the area.

modifierOptions.name: Burst Area
modifierOptions.description: The effect fills a sphere with a 30-foot radius (distance rank 0) for rank 1 of the extra. Bursts on level surfaces (like the ground) create hemispheres 30 feet in radius and height.

modifierOptions.name: Cloud Area
modifierOptions.description: The effect fills a sphere with a 15-foot radius (distance rank –1) for rank 1 of the extra, that lingers in that area for one round after its duration expires (affecting any targets in the area normally during the additional round). Clouds on level surfaces (like the ground) create hemispheres 15 feet in radius and height.

modifierOptions.name: Cone Area
modifierOptions.description: The effect fills a cone with a length, width, and height of 60 feet (distance rank 1) for rank 1 of the extra, spreading out from the effect's starting point. Cones on a level surface halve their final height.

modifierOptions.name: Cylinder Area
modifierOptions.description: The effect fills a cylinder 30 feet in radius and height (distance rank 0) for rank 1 of the extra.

modifierOptions.name: Line Area
modifierOptions.description: The effect fills a path 6 feet wide and 30 feet long (distance ranks -2 and 0, respectively) in a straight line. Additional ranks of area increases the length. To increase the width, purchase additional ranks for that.

modifierOptions.name: Perception Area
modifierOptions.description: The effect works on anyone able to perceive the target point with a particular sense, chosen when you apply this extra, like a Sense-Dependent effect (see the Sense-Dependent modifier). Targets get a Dodge resistance check, as usual, but if the check is successful suffer no effect (rather than half). Concealment that prevents a target from perceiving the effect also blocks it. This modifier includes the Sense-Dependent flaw (see Flaws) so it cannot be applied again.

modifierOptions.name: Shapeable Area
modifierOptions.description: The effect fills a volume of 30 cubic feet (volume rank 5) for rank 1 of the extra, and you may shape the volume as you wish, so long as it all remains contiguous. Affecting an average-sized human requires 4 cubic feet (volume rank 2).

extras.name: Broad
extras.description: Broad Nullify can counter effects of a particularly broad descriptor like magical, mutant, or technological effects. This modifier is available only with the GameMaster’s permission and may depend on the effects available in the series.

extras.name: Concentration
extras.description: Any countered effect is suppressed and cannot be reactivated while you concentrate.

extras.name: Simultaneous
extras.description: Simultaneous Nullify can counter all effects of a particular descriptor (such as fire or magic) at once.

extras.name: Effortless
extras.description: Trying again after two or more degrees of failure does not require extra effort for you. You can retry a Nullify attempt an unlimited number of times.

extras.name: Precise
extras.description: If you can Nullify multiple effects, this modifier allows you to choose which are nullified and which are not.

extras.name: Randomize
extras.description: Rather than being countered, the effect(s) targeted by your Nullify acquire the Uncontrolled flaw and go out of control (as dictated by the GM).

extras.name: Selective
extras.description: If you have an Area Nullify effect, this extra allows you to choose who in the area is affected, nullifying some targets and not others.

extras.name: Sustained
extras.description: If this modifier is applied to Concentration Nullify, keeping the countered effect(s) suppressed is only a free action for you each turn.

flaws.name: Side Effect
flaws.description: If you fail to nullify an effect, you might suffer some kind of "backlash" or similar side effect.

Protection.name: Protection
Protection.description: Protection shields you against damage, giving you +1 Toughness defense per rank.

flaws.name: Sustained
flaws.description: Your Protection is a sustained effect, rather than permanent.

Quickness.name: Quickness
Quickness.description: You can perform routine tasks fast.

flaws.name: Limited to One Type
flaws.description: Your Quickness applies to only physical or mental tasks, not both.

flaws.name: Limited to One Task
flaws.description: Your Quickness applies to only one particular task, such as reading, mathematical calculations, and so forth.

extras.name: Persistent
extras.description: You can regenerate even Incurable damage conditions.

flaws.name: Source
flaws.description: Your Regeneration only works when you have access to a particular source to replenish yourself, such as blood, electricity, sand, scrap metal, sunlight, and so forth.

Remote Sensing.name: Remote Sensing
Remote Sensing.description: You can displace one or more of your senses over a distance of 60ft * 2 per rank above 1.

One Sense Type.name: One Sense Type
One Sense Type.description: Sense remotely with just one sense.

Two Sense Types.name: Two Sense Types
Two Sense Types.description: Sense remotely with two different senses (or 1 visual sense).

Three Sense Types.name: Three Sense Types
Three Sense Types.description: Sense remotely with three different senses (or 1 visual and 1 other).

Four Sense Types.name: Four Sense Types
Four Sense Types.description: Sense remotely with four different senses (visual sense costs 2).

Five Sense Types.name: Five Sense Types
Five Sense Types.description: Sense remotely with all of your senses.

extras.name: Dimensional
extras.description: You can extend your Remote Sensing into other dimensions with range proximate to your location in that dimension.

modifierOptions.name: Sense in one dimension
modifierOptions.description: Sense remotely in "nearby" areas in one dimension.

modifierOptions.name: Sense in related dimensions
modifierOptions.description: Sense remotely in "nearby" areas in a group of related dimensions.

modifierOptions.name: Sense in any dimension
modifierOptions.description: Sense remotely in "nearby" areas of any dimension.

extras.name: No Conduit
extras.description: Sensory effects targeted where you have displaced your senses do not affect you (and you cannot use the sense for perception-ranged attacks).

extras.name: Simultaneous
extras.description: You can use both Remote Sensing and your normal senses at the same time, perceiving two locales like "translucent" overlays of each other. You are not vulnerable while using your Remote Sensing.

extras.name: Subtle
extras.description: Your Remote Sensing is even more subtle than normal Remote Sensing.

modifierOptions.name: Difficult to Notice
modifierOptions.description: The DC to notice the effect to 20 + ranks in Remote Sense.

modifierOptions.name: Limited Detection
modifierOptions.description: The use of Remote Sense can only be detected by one particular sense.

modifierOptions.name: Completely Unnoticeable
modifierOptions.description: The Remote Sensing cannot be detected.

flaws.name: Feedback
flaws.description: Damaging attacks directed at where you displaced your senses can affect you. Your sensory-point is considered to have partial cover from attacks and you use your Remote Sensing rank as your Toughness defense against any successful attack.

flaws.name: Medium
flaws.description: You require a medium for your Remote Sensing, such as shadows, flames, mirrors, open water, television screens, and so forth. You can only perceive locations where your chosen medium exists.

flaws.name: Noticeable
flaws.description: Remote Sensing with this flaw has an easily noticeable display, like a glowing set of eyes or a phantom image of your face, head, or body at the location you are observing.

Senses.name: Senses
Senses.description: One or more of your senses are improved or you have additional sensory abilities beyond the normal five senses. See documentation for the number of ranks required.

extras.name: Affects Others
extras.description: This modifier allows you to extend your Insubstantial effect to another character by touch, taking them Insubstantial with you.

modifierOptions.name: Affects Only Others
modifierOptions.description: The effect affects only others, and not you.

modifierOptions.name: Self and Others
modifierOptions.description: It can affect yourself and others.

extras.name: Area
extras.description: For Senses, Area only applies if you have Affects Others, to control who is affected.

modifierOptions.name: Burst Area
modifierOptions.description: The effect fills a sphere with a 30-foot radius (distance rank 0) for rank 1 of the extra. Bursts on level surfaces (like the ground) create hemispheres 30 feet in radius and height.

modifierOptions.name: Cloud Area
modifierOptions.description: The effect fills a sphere with a 15-foot radius (distance rank –1) for rank 1 of the extra, that lingers in that area for one round after its duration expires (affecting any targets in the area normally during the additional round). Clouds on level surfaces (like the ground) create hemispheres 15 feet in radius and height.

modifierOptions.name: Cone Area
modifierOptions.description: The effect fills a cone with a length, width, and height of 60 feet (distance rank 1) for rank 1 of the extra, spreading out from the effect's starting point. Cones on a level surface halve their final height.

modifierOptions.name: Cylinder Area
modifierOptions.description: The effect fills a cylinder 30 feet in radius and height (distance rank 0) for rank 1 of the extra.

modifierOptions.name: Line Area
modifierOptions.description: The effect fills a path 6 feet wide and 30 feet long (distance ranks -2 and 0, respectively) in a straight line. Additional ranks of area increases the length. To increase the width, purchase additional ranks for that.

modifierOptions.name: Perception Area
modifierOptions.description: The effect works on anyone able to perceive the target point with a particular sense, chosen when you apply this extra, like a Sense-Dependent effect (see the Sense-Dependent modifier). Targets get a Dodge resistance check, as usual, but if the check is successful suffer no effect (rather than half). Concealment that prevents a target from perceiving the effect also blocks it. This modifier includes the Sense-Dependent flaw (see Flaws) so it cannot be applied again.

modifierOptions.name: Shapeable Area
modifierOptions.description: The effect fills a volume of 30 cubic feet (volume rank 5) for rank 1 of the extra, and you may shape the volume as you wish, so long as it all remains contiguous. Affecting an average-sized human requires 4 cubic feet (volume rank 2).

extras.name: Dimensional
extras.description: This modifier allows you to extend your senses into other dimensions. It's assumed to apply to all your senses, allowing you to sense your proximate location in the other dimension(s).

extras.name: Innate
extras.description: Senses, particularly those of aliens or constructs like robots, may be Innate, although this does not prevent sensory effects like Concealment or Dazzle from disabling them.

extras.name: Ranged
extras.description: The Ranged extra only applies to Senses that Affect Others, extending the distance at which you can grant their benefits.

modifierOptions.name: Use Ranged
modifierOptions.description: Grant your Affects Others Sense to others from a distance.

modifierOptions.name: Use at Perception Range
modifierOptions.description: Grant your Affects Others Sense to anyone you can perceive.

flaws.name: Limited
flaws.description: Your Sense is Limited to only sensing certain things or only under certain circumstances. As usual, the sense must lose about half its utility to qualify for this flaw.

flaws.name: Noticeable
flaws.description: Senses with this flaw are particularly noticeable in some way: your eyes may glow, for example, or you may emit a noticeable sound, vibration, energy, or the like for use as a sensor.

flaws.name: Unreliable
flaws.description: Remote Sensing with this flaw has an easily noticeable display, like a glowing set of eyes or a phantom image of your face, head, or body at the location you are observing.

modifierOptions.name: Sense Fails Sometimes
modifierOptions.description: Sense fails to function when the check is failed.

modifierOptions.name: Sense is Wrong Sometimes
modifierOptions.description: Sense appears to work but gives unreliable information.

Shrinking.name: Shrinking
Shrinking.description: You can temporarily decrease your size.

extras.name: Atomic
extras.description: At Shrinking 20 (and size rank –7), you can shrink down to the molecular or even atomic level, allowing you to pass through solid objects by slipping between their atoms. You’re effectively immune to damage and many effects at this scale.

extras.name: Normal Strength
extras.description: You retain your full Strength, Speed, and Intimidation while shrunk.

Speed.name: Speed
Speed.description: You can move faster than normal.

Summon.name: Summon
Summon.description: You can call upon another creature to aid you.

extras.name: Active
extras.description: Your minions are particularly independent and do not have the dazed condition, having a full set of actions each round.

extras.name: Controlled
extras.description: Your minions all have the controlled condition. They have no free will of their own and are completely under your direction.

extras.name: Heroic
extras.description: The creatures you summon are not subject to the minion rules, but treated like normal non-player characters. Additionally, they do not have the dazed condition and take a full set of actions each round.

extras.name: Horde
extras.description: If you have Multiple Minions you may take a standard action to summon any number of minions up to your maximum amount. You are vulnerable (see the Distracting flaw) until the start of your next turn when summoning a horde.

extras.name: Mental Link
extras.description: You have a mental link with your minions, allowing you to communicate with them and issue orders telepathically like the Communication Link effect.

extras.name: Multiple Minions
extras.description: Each rank of this extra doubles your total number of minions.

extras.name: Sacrifice
extras.description: When you are hit with an effect requiring a resistance check, you can spend a hero point to shift it to one of your minions instead.

extras.name: Variable Type
extras.description: Minions are normally identical in terms of traits, although they may differ cosmetically. With this modifier you can summon different types of minions.

modifierOptions.name: Variable Within a General Type
modifierOptions.description: You can summon different minions of a general type (like elementals, birds, fish, etc.).

modifierOptions.name: Variable Within a Broad Type
modifierOptions.description: You can summon different minions of a broad type (like animals, demons, humanoids, etc.).

flaws.name: Attitude
flaws.description: Your summoned minions are less than cooperative.: indifferent or even unfriendly.

modifierOptions.name: Minions are Indifferent
modifierOptions.description: Your summoned minions are indifferent toward you.

modifierOptions.name: Minions are Unfriendly
modifierOptions.description: Your summoned minions are unfriendly toward you.

flaws.name: Resistible
flaws.description: Your minions get an appropriate resistance check (typically Will) against (DC 10 + Summon rank) to avoid being summoned. If they successfully resist, you cannot attempt to summon them again in that scene without using extra effort.

Swimming.name: Swimming
Swimming.description: You can swim fast. You have a water speed equal to your Swimming rank –2. You can make Athletics checks to swim as routine checks.

Teleport.name: Teleport
Teleport.description: You can move instantly from place to place.

extras.name: Accurate
extras.description: You don't need to know or accurately sense your destination to teleport there, just be able to generally describe it, such as "inside the capitol building lobby" or "atop the Emerald Tower's roof."

extras.name: Change Direction
extras.description: You can change your direction or orientation after a teleport

extras.name: Change Velocity
extras.description: You can teleport "at rest" to your destination.

extras.name: Easy
extras.description: You are not dazed or vulnerable when making extended teleports.

extras.name: Extended
extras.description: You can take two move actions to make an extended teleport with a distance rank equal to your effect rank +8. You are dazed and vulnerable for one round after an extended teleport.

extras.name: Increased Mass
extras.description: You can carry additional mass when you teleport equal to your rank in this extra.

extras.name: Portal
extras.description: You open a portal or gateway between two points as a free action. The portal is five feet across. Anyone stepping through the portal (a move action) is transported. The portal remains open as long as you concentrate, taking a standard action each turn to maintain it.

extras.name: Turnabout
extras.description: You can teleport, take a standard action, and teleport back to your starting point in a single round, so long as the total distance moved doesn't exceed your Teleport range.

flaws.name: Limited to Extended
flaws.description: You can only make extended teleports. You must have the Extended extra, and this flaw effectively makes it a +0 modifier.

flaws.name: Medium
flaws.description: You require a medium for your teleportation, such as electrical or telephone wires, root structures, waterways, shadows, flames, mirrors, and so forth. You can only teleport from and to locations where your medium exists.

Transform.name: Transform
Transform.description: You can change objects into other objects.

Single Transform.name: Single Transform
Single Transform.description: Transform one thing or substance into one other thing or substance, such as metal into wood, iron into glass, or broken objects into repaired ones.

Transform Group of Things.name: Transform Group of Things
Transform Group of Things.description: Transform a broad group of things into a single result (any metal into gold, for example) or a single target into any of a broad group (one type of metal, such as lead, into any other metal, water into other liquids, and so forth).

Transform Entire Category.name: Transform Entire Category
Transform Entire Category.description: Transform a broad group of targets into one of a broad group of results (solids into other solids, for example).

Transform Anything.name: Transform Anything
Transform Anything.description: Transform any material into anything else.

Variable.name: Variable
Variable.description: You can gain or use potentially any effect of the appropriate type and descriptor!

extras.name: Action
extras.description: You can change the configuration of your effect faster.

modifierOptions.name: Change as a Move Action
modifierOptions.description: You can change the configuration of your effect as a Move Action.

modifierOptions.name: Change as a Free Action
modifierOptions.description: You can change the configuration of your effect as a Free Action, but not more than once per turn.

modifierOptions.name: Change as a Reaction
modifierOptions.description: You can change the configuration of your effect as a Reaction.

extras.name: Affects Others
extras.description: You can grant effects to someone else. The subject granted the use of the effect controls its configuration.

modifierOptions.name: Affects Only Others
modifierOptions.description: You can only grant this power to someone else (not yourself). They control the variable effect.

modifierOptions.name: Affects Others
modifierOptions.description: Your variable power can affect yourself as well as others. The affected individual controls the variable effect.

extras.name: Perception
extras.description: Applied to a Ranged Affects Others Variable, this extra allows you to grant the benefits of the effect to any target you can accurately perceive.

extras.name: Ranged
extras.description: A Variable effect with Affects Others may have the Ranged extra to improve the range at which you can grant the effect to another. This does not alter the ranges of the effect's various configurations.

flaws.name: Limited
flaws.description: A Variable effect is always restricted to certain descriptors, to qualify for this flaw, the effect must be even more limited. An example is a Variable effect only able to provide Enhanced Skills.

flaws.name: Slow
flaws.description: You can only reconfigure your Variable effect outside of action time. It takes at least a minute, possibly as long as an hour or more.

Weaken.name: Weaken
Weaken.description: You can temporarily lower one of your target's traits.

extras.name: Affects Objects
extras.description: Weaken with this modifier works on inanimate objects.

modifierOptions.name: Affects Only Objects
modifierOptions.description: Weaken works only on objects and not on living creatures.

modifierOptions.name: Affects Objects
modifierOptions.description: Weaken works on objects in the same way as it does on living creatures.

extras.name: Broad
extras.description: You can Weaken any of a broad set of traits, one at a time suited to your effects descriptors.

extras.name: Concentration
extras.description: Once you have hit with a Concentration Weaken, so long as you continue to take a standard action each turn to maintain the effect, the target must make a new resistance check against it, with no attack check required.

extras.name: Incurable
extras.description: Weaken with this modifier cannot have its effects countered by another power (such as Restorative Healing) without the Persistent modifier; the target must recover from the Weaken normally.

extras.name: Precise
extras.description: A Weaken effect capable of reducing more than one trait at once can have this modifier, allowing you to choose which traits are affected, while not affecting others.

extras.name: Progressive
extras.description: A Progressive Weaken effect reduces the affected traits each round until the target successfully resists.

extras.name: Selective
extras.description: This extra is applied to an Area Weaken so it only affects some targets and not others.

extras.name: Simultaneous
extras.description: If applied to a Broad Weaken, this extra allows it to affect all of the traits in its set at the same time.
